t: Isaiah 26
A Song of Praise
In*p that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah: We*pn have a strong city; God*ld makes salvation its*ld walls and ramparts.
Open*ln the gates that*ld the righteous nation may enter, the*ld nation that keeps faith.
You*ln will keep in perfect peace those*ld whose minds are steadfast, because*ld they trust in you.
Trust*ln in the Lord*s forever, for*ld the Lord,*s the Lord*s himself, is the Rock eternal.
He*ln humbles those who dwell on high, he*ld lays the lofty city low; he*ln levels it to the ground and*ld casts it down to the dust.
Feet*ln trample it down— the*ld feet of the oppressed, the*ld footsteps of the poor.
The*pn path of the righteous is level; you,*ld the Upright One, make the way of the righteous smooth.
Yes,*ln Lord,*s walking in the way of your laws, we*ld wait for you; your*ln name and renown are*ld the desire of our hearts.
My*ln soul yearns for you in the night; in*ld the morning my spirit longs for you. When*ln your judgments come upon the earth, the*ld people of the world learn righteousness.
But*ln when grace is shown to the wicked, they*ld do not learn righteousness; even*ln in a land of uprightness they go on doing evil and*ld do not regard the majesty of the Lord.*s
Lord,*sln your hand is lifted high, but*ld they do not see it. Let*ln them see your zeal for your people and be put to shame; let*ld the fire reserved for your enemies consume them.
Lord,*spn you establish peace for us; all*ld that we have accomplished you have done for us.
Lord*sln our God, other lords besides you have ruled over us, but*ld your name alone do we honor.
They*ln are now dead, they live no more; their*ld spirits do not rise. You*ln punished them and brought them to ruin; you*ld wiped out all memory of them.
You*ln have enlarged the nation, Lord;*s you*ld have enlarged the nation. You*ln have gained glory for yourself; you*ld have extended all the borders of the land.
Lord,*spn they came to you in their distress; when*ld you disciplined them, they*ld could barely whisper a prayer.
As*ln a pregnant woman about to give birth writhes*ld and cries out in her pain, so*ld were we in your presence, Lord.*s
We*ln were with child, we writhed in labor, but*ld we gave birth to wind. We*ln have not brought salvation to the earth, and*ld the people of the world have not come to life.

But*pn your dead will live, Lord;*s their*ld bodies will rise— let*ln those who dwell in the dust wake*ld up and shout for joy— your*ln dew is like the dew of the morning; the*ld earth will give birth to her dead.
Go,*pn my people, enter your rooms and*ld shut the doors behind you; hide*ln yourselves for a little while until*ld his wrath has passed by.
See,*ln the Lord*s is coming out of his dwelling to*ld punish the people of the earth for their sins. The*ln earth will disclose the blood shed on it; the*ld earth will conceal its slain no longer.
